name: redpanda
description: A Pulumi package for creating and managing redpanda cloud resources.
attribution: This Pulumi package is based on the [`redpanda` Terraform Provider](https://github.com/redpanda-data/terraform-provider-redpanda).

nodejs.packageDescription: A Pulumi package for creating and managing redpanda cloud resources.
nodejs.readme:
> This provider is a derived work of the [Terraform Provider](https://github.com/redpanda-data/terraform-provider-redpanda)
> distributed under [MPL 2.0](https://www.mozilla.org/en-US/MPL/2.0/). If you encounter a bug or missing feature,
> first check the [`pulumi-redpanda` repo](https://github.com/primait/pulumi-redpanda/issues); however, if that doesn't turn up anything,
> please consult the source [`terraform-provider-redpanda` repo](https://github.com/redpanda-data/terraform-provider-redpanda/issues).

python.readme:
> This provider is a derived work of the [Terraform Provider](https://github.com/redpanda-data/terraform-provider-redpanda)
> distributed under [MPL 2.0](https://www.mozilla.org/en-US/MPL/2.0/). If you encounter a bug or missing feature,
> first check the [`pulumi-redpanda` repo](https://github.com/primait/pulumi-redpanda/issues); however, if that doesn't turn up anything,
> please consult the source [`terraform-provider-redpanda` repo](https://github.com/redpanda-data/terraform-provider-redpanda/issues).

accessToken.description: Redpanda client token. You need either `access_token`, or both `client_id` and `client_secret` to use this provider. Can also be set with the `REDPANDA_ACCESS_TOKEN` environment variable.

azureClientId.description: Used for creating and managing BYOC and BYOVPC clusters. Can also be specified in the environment as AZURE_CLIENT_ID or ARM_CLIENT_ID

azureClientSecret.description: Used for creating and managing BYOC and BYOVPC clusters. Can also be specified in the environment as AZURE_CLIENT_SECRET or ARM_CLIENT_SECRET

azureSubscriptionId.description: The default Azure Subscription ID which should be used for Redpanda BYOC clusters. If another subscription is specified on a resource, it will take precedence. This can also be sourced from the `ARM_SUBSCRIPTION_ID` environment variable.

azureTenantId.description: Used for creating and managing BYOC and BYOVPC clusters. Can also be specified in the environment as AZURE_TENANT_ID or ARM_TENANT_ID

clientId.description: The ID for the client. You need either `client_id` AND `client_secret`, or `access_token`, to use this provider. Can also be set with the `REDPANDA_CLIENT_ID` environment variable.

clientSecret.description: Redpanda client secret. You need either `client_id` AND `client_secret`, or `access_token`, to use this provider. Can also be set with the `REDPANDA_CLIENT_SECRET` environment variable.

gcpProjectId.description: The default Google Cloud Project ID to use for Redpanda BYOC clusters. If another project is specified on a resource, it will take precedence. This can also be sourced from the `GOOGLE_PROJECT` environment variable, or any of the following ordered by precedence: `GOOGLE_PROJECT`, `GOOGLE_CLOUD_PROJECT`, `GCLOUD_PROJECT`, or `CLOUDSDK_CORE_PROJECT`.

googleCredentials.description: Used for creating and managing BYOC and BYOVPC clusters. Can also be specified in the environment as GOOGLE_CREDENTIALS

googleCredentialsBase64.description: Used for creating and managing BYOC and BYOVPC clusters. Is a convenience passthrough for base64 encoded credentials intended for use in CI/CD. Can also be specified in the environment as GOOGLE_CREDENTIALS_BASE64

allowedPrincipals.description: The ARN of the principals that can access the Redpanda AWS PrivateLink Endpoint Service. To grant permissions to all principals, use an asterisk (*).

connectConsole.description: Whether Console is connected via PrivateLink.

status.description: Current status of the PrivateLink configuration.

createdAt.description: When the PrivateLink service was created.

deletedAt.description: When the PrivateLink service was deleted.

kafkaApiNodeBasePort.description: Base port for Kafka API nodes.

kafkaApiSeedPort.description: Port for Kafka API seed brokers.

redpandaProxyNodeBasePort.description: Base port for HTTP proxy nodes.

serviceState.description: Current state of the PrivateLink service.

createdAt.description: When the endpoint connection was created.

allowedSubscriptions.description: The subscriptions that can access the Redpanda Azure PrivateLink Endpoint Service. To grant permissions to all principals, use an asterisk (*).

connectConsole.description: Whether Console is connected in Redpanda Azure Private Link Service.

enabled.description: Whether Redpanda Azure Private Link Endpoint Service is enabled.

status.description: Current status of the Private Link configuration.

approvedSubscriptions.description: List of approved Azure subscription IDs.

createdAt.description: When the Private Link service was created.

deletedAt.description: When the Private Link service was deleted.

dnsARecord.description: DNS A record for the service.

kafkaApiNodeBasePort.description: Base port for Kafka API nodes.

kafkaApiSeedPort.description: Port for Kafka API seed brokers.

redpandaProxyNodeBasePort.description: Base port for HTTP proxy nodes.

createdAt.description: When the endpoint connection was created.

agentServiceAccount.description: GCP service account for the agent.

connectorServiceAccount.description: GCP service account for managed connectors.

consoleServiceAccount.description: GCP service account for Redpanda Console.

gkeServiceAccount.description: GCP service account for GCP Kubernetes Engine (GKE).

pscNatSubnetName.description: NAT subnet name if GCP Private Service Connect is enabled.

redpandaClusterServiceAccount.description: GCP service account for the Redpanda cluster.

subnet.description: GCP subnet where Redpanda cluster is deployed.

tieredStorageBucket.description: GCP storage bucket for Tiered storage.

name.description: Subnet name.
Secondary IPv4 range name for pods.
Secondary IPv4 range name for services.
GCP storage bucket name.

consumerAcceptLists.description: List of consumers that are allowed to connect to Redpanda GCP PSC (Private Service Connect) service attachment.

enabled.description: Whether Redpanda GCP Private Service Connect is enabled.

status.description: Current status of the Private Service Connect configuration.

source.description: Either the GCP project number or its alphanumeric ID.

createdAt.description: When the Private Service Connect service was created.

deletedAt.description: When the Private Service Connect service was deleted.

dnsARecords.description: DNS A records for the service.

kafkaApiNodeBasePort.description: Base port for Kafka API nodes.

kafkaApiSeedPort.description: Port for Kafka API seed brokers.

redpandaProxyNodeBasePort.description: Base port for HTTP proxy nodes.

principalMappingRules.description: Principal mapping rules for mTLS authentication. See the Redpanda documentation on configuring authentication.
Principal mapping rules for mTLS authentication. See the Redpanda documentation on configuring authentication.

anytime.description: If true, maintenance can occur at any time.

unspecified.description: If true, maintenance window is unspecified.

principalMappingRules.description: Principal mapping rules for mTLS authentication. See the Redpanda documentation on configuring authentication.

code.description: Error code if cluster is in error state.

message.description: Detailed error message if cluster is in error state.

create.description: A string that can be [parsed as a duration](https://pkg.go.dev/time#ParseDuration) consisting of numbers and unit suffixes, such as "30s" or "2h45m". Valid time units are "s" (seconds), "m" (minutes), "h" (hours).

delete.description: A string that can be [parsed as a duration](https://pkg.go.dev/time#ParseDuration) consisting of numbers and unit suffixes, such as "30s" or "2h45m". Valid time units are "s" (seconds), "m" (minutes), "h" (hours). Setting a timeout for a Delete operation is only applicable if changes are saved into state before the destroy operation occurs.

update.description: A string that can be [parsed as a duration](https://pkg.go.dev/time#ParseDuration) consisting of numbers and unit suffixes, such as "30s" or "2h45m". Valid time units are "s" (seconds), "m" (minutes), "h" (hours).

arn.description: AWS DynamoDB table identifier
AWS storage bucket identifier
AWS VPC identifier

networkName.description: Name of user-created network where the Redpanda cluster is deployed

networkProjectId.description: GCP project ID where the network is created

name.description: GCP storage bucket name for storing the state of Redpanda cluster deployment

The client secret for the service account (write-only, not stored in state). Requires Terraform 1.11+.

secretVersion.description: Version number for client_secret. Increment to trigger a secret update.

provider.description:
The provider type for the redpanda package. By default, resources use package-wide configuration
settings, however an explicit `Provider` instance may be created and passed during resource
construction to achieve fine-grained programmatic control over provider settings. See the
[documentation](https://www.pulumi.com/docs/reference/programming-model/#providers) for more information.

accessToken.description: Redpanda client token. You need either `access_token`, or both `client_id` and `client_secret` to use this provider. Can also be set with the `REDPANDA_ACCESS_TOKEN` environment variable.

azureClientId.description: Used for creating and managing BYOC and BYOVPC clusters. Can also be specified in the environment as AZURE_CLIENT_ID or ARM_CLIENT_ID

azureClientSecret.description: Used for creating and managing BYOC and BYOVPC clusters. Can also be specified in the environment as AZURE_CLIENT_SECRET or ARM_CLIENT_SECRET

azureSubscriptionId.description: The default Azure Subscription ID which should be used for Redpanda BYOC clusters. If another subscription is specified on a resource, it will take precedence. This can also be sourced from the `ARM_SUBSCRIPTION_ID` environment variable.

azureTenantId.description: Used for creating and managing BYOC and BYOVPC clusters. Can also be specified in the environment as AZURE_TENANT_ID or ARM_TENANT_ID

clientId.description: The ID for the client. You need either `client_id` AND `client_secret`, or `access_token`, to use this provider. Can also be set with the `REDPANDA_CLIENT_ID` environment variable.

clientSecret.description: Redpanda client secret. You need either `client_id` AND `client_secret`, or `access_token`, to use this provider. Can also be set with the `REDPANDA_CLIENT_SECRET` environment variable.

gcpProjectId.description: The default Google Cloud Project ID to use for Redpanda BYOC clusters. If another project is specified on a resource, it will take precedence. This can also be sourced from the `GOOGLE_PROJECT` environment variable, or any of the following ordered by precedence: `GOOGLE_PROJECT`, `GOOGLE_CLOUD_PROJECT`, `GCLOUD_PROJECT`, or `CLOUDSDK_CORE_PROJECT`.

googleCredentials.description: Used for creating and managing BYOC and BYOVPC clusters. Can also be specified in the environment as GOOGLE_CREDENTIALS

googleCredentialsBase64.description: Used for creating and managing BYOC and BYOVPC clusters. Is a convenience passthrough for base64 encoded credentials intended for use in CI/CD. Can also be specified in the environment as GOOGLE_CREDENTIALS_BASE64

allowDeletion.description: When set to true, allows the resource to be removed from state even if the cluster is unreachable

clusterApiUrl.description: The cluster API URL. Changing this will prevent deletion of the resource on the existing cluster. It is generally a better idea to delete an existing resource and create a new one than to change this value unless you are planning to do state imports

host.description: The host address to use for this ACL

operation.description: The operation type that shall be allowed or denied (e.g READ)

permissionType.description: The permission type. It determines whether the operation should be ALLOWED or DENIED

principal.description: The principal to apply this ACL for

resourceName.description: The name of the resource this ACL entry will be on

resourcePatternType.description: The pattern type of the resource. It determines the strategy how the provided resource name is matched (LITERAL, MATCH, PREFIXED, etc ...) against the actual resource names

resourceType.description: The type of the resource (TOPIC, GROUP, etc...) this ACL shall target

allowDeletion.description: Allows deletion of the cluster. Defaults to false.

cloudProvider.description: Cloud provider where resources are created.

clusterApiUrl.description: The URL of the cluster API.

clusterType.description: Cluster type. Type is immutable and can only be set on cluster creation. Can be either byoc or dedicated.

connectionType.description: Cluster connection type. Private clusters are not exposed to the internet. For BYOC clusters, private is best-practice.

createdAt.description: Timestamp when the cluster was created.

customerManagedResources.description: Customer managed resources configuration for the cluster.

gcpGlobalAccessEnabled.description: If true, GCP global access is enabled.

maintenanceWindowConfig.description: Maintenance window configuration for the cluster.

name.description: Unique name of the cluster.

networkId.description: Network ID where cluster is placed.

readReplicaClusterIds.description: IDs of clusters that can create read-only topics from this cluster.

redpandaNodeCount.description: Number of Redpanda nodes in the cluster. NOTE: This feature is not available for all customers by default. Contact your Redpanda account team to enable this feature.

redpandaVersion.description: Current Redpanda version of the cluster.

region.description: Cloud provider region. Region represents the name of the region where the cluster will be provisioned.

resourceGroupId.description: Resource group ID of the cluster.

stateDescription.description: Detailed state description when cluster is in a non-ready state.

tags.description: Tags placed on cloud resources. If the cloud provider is GCP and the name of a tag has the prefix "gcp.network-tag.", the tag is a network tag that will be added to the Redpanda cluster GKE nodes. Otherwise, the tag is a normal tag. For example, if the name of a tag is "gcp.network-tag.network-tag-foo", the network tag named "network-tag-foo" will be added to the Redpanda cluster GKE nodes. Note: The value of a network tag will be ignored. See the details on network tags at https://cloud.google.com/vpc/docs/add-remove-network-tags.

zones.description: Zones of the cluster. Must be valid zones within the selected region. If multiple zones are used, the cluster is a multi-AZ cluster.

allowDeletion.description: Allows deletion of the cluster. Defaults to false.

cloudProvider.description: Cloud provider where resources are created.

clusterType.description: Cluster type. Type is immutable and can only be set on cluster creation. Can be either byoc or dedicated.

connectionType.description: Cluster connection type. Private clusters are not exposed to the internet. For BYOC clusters, private is best-practice.

customerManagedResources.description: Customer managed resources configuration for the cluster.

gcpGlobalAccessEnabled.description: If true, GCP global access is enabled.

maintenanceWindowConfig.description: Maintenance window configuration for the cluster.

name.description: Unique name of the cluster.

networkId.description: Network ID where cluster is placed.

readReplicaClusterIds.description: IDs of clusters that can create read-only topics from this cluster.

redpandaNodeCount.description: Number of Redpanda nodes in the cluster. NOTE: This feature is not available for all customers by default. Contact your Redpanda account team to enable this feature.

redpandaVersion.description: Current Redpanda version of the cluster.

region.description: Cloud provider region. Region represents the name of the region where the cluster will be provisioned.

resourceGroupId.description: Resource group ID of the cluster.

tags.description: Tags placed on cloud resources. If the cloud provider is GCP and the name of a tag has the prefix "gcp.network-tag.", the tag is a network tag that will be added to the Redpanda cluster GKE nodes. Otherwise, the tag is a normal tag. For example, if the name of a tag is "gcp.network-tag.network-tag-foo", the network tag named "network-tag-foo" will be added to the Redpanda cluster GKE nodes. Note: The value of a network tag will be ignored. See the details on network tags at https://cloud.google.com/vpc/docs/add-remove-network-tags.

allowDeletion.description: Allows deletion of the pipeline. Default is false. Must be set to true to delete the resource.

clusterApiUrl.description: The cluster API URL. Changing this will prevent deletion of the resource on the existing cluster. It is generally a better idea to delete an existing resource and create a new one than to change this value unless you are planning to do state imports.

configYaml.description: The Redpanda Connect pipeline configuration in YAML format. See https://docs.redpanda.com/redpanda-cloud/develop/connect/configuration/about for configuration details.

displayName.description: User-friendly display name for the pipeline.

serviceAccount.description: Service account credentials for the pipeline. Used to authenticate the pipeline with external services.

state.description: Desired state of the pipeline: 'running' or 'stopped'. The provider will ensure the pipeline reaches this state after create/update operations.

tags.description: Key-value pairs to tag the pipeline for organization and filtering.

url.description: URL to connect to the pipeline's HTTP server, if applicable.

allowDeletion.description: When enabled, prevents the resource from being deleted if the cluster is unreachable. When disabled (default), the resource will be removed from state without attempting deletion when the cluster is unreachable.

clusterId.description: The ID of the cluster where the schema is stored.

compatibility.description: The compatibility level for schema evolution (BACKWARD, BACKWARD_TRANSITIVE, FORWARD, FORWARD_TRANSITIVE, FULL, FULL_TRANSITIVE, NONE). Defaults to BACKWARD.

password.description: The SASL password for Schema Registry authentication. Deprecated: use password_wo instead.
password.deprecationMessage: Use password_wo instead to avoid storing password in Terraform state

passwordWo.description:
**NOTE:** This field is write-only and its value will not be updated in state as part of read operations.
The SASL password for Schema Registry authentication (write-only, not stored in state). Requires Terraform 1.11+.

passwordWoVersion.description: Version number for password_wo. Increment this value to trigger a password update when using password_wo.

schema.description: The schema definition in JSON format.

schemaType.description: The type of schema (AVRO, JSON, PROTOBUF).

subject.description: The subject name for the schema.

username.description: The SASL username for Schema Registry authentication.

allowDeletion.description: Indicates whether the topic can be deleted.

clusterApiUrl.description: The cluster API URL. Changing this will prevent deletion of the resource on the existing cluster. It is generally a better idea to delete an existing resource and create a new one than to change this value unless you are planning to do state imports

configuration.description: A map of string key/value pairs of topic configurations.

name.description: The name of the topic.

partitionCount.description: The number of partitions for the topic. This determines how the data is distributed across brokers. Increases are fully supported without data loss. Decreases will destroy and recreate the topic if allow_deletion is set to true (defaults to false).

replicationFactor.description: The replication factor for the topic, which defines how many copies of the data are kept across different brokers for fault tolerance.
